contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox mountain | name = Vakak Group | photo = | photo_caption = | elevation_m = 3190 | elevation_ref = | prominence = | location = [[Afghanistan]] | range = | coordinates = {{coord|34|15|0|N|67|58|12|E|type:mountain_region:AF}} | topo = | type = [[Volcanic field]] | age = [[Holocene]]? | last_eruption = Unknown | first_ascent = | easiest_route = }} The '''Vakak Group''' (also spelled Wakak) is a small [[volcanic field]] located WSW of [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]]. It consists of 18 [[dacitic]] and [[trachytic]] volcanoes including [[lava dome]]s and possibly an old [[caldera]]. ==See also== * [[List of volcanoes in Afghanistan]] * [[Lists of volcanoes]] ==References== * {{cite gvp |vnum=0302-07-|title=Vakak Group}} [[Category:Volcanoes of Afghanistan]] [[Category:Mountains of Afghanistan]] [[Category:Lava domes]] [[Category:Holocene volcanoes]] [[Category:Inactive volcanoes]] {{Afghanistan-geo-stub}}
